pullRequest.body:
We derive the inequality between the harmonic and geometric mean as a consequence of AM-GM for positive real valued functions from a `Finset`. We state a weighted as well as the classical version. 

---

### PR summary [48b77b8d2f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13721/commits/48b77b8d2ff070f6bec2ca7fea1d8a20307504ac)

`+ harm_mean_le_geom_mean_weighted`

```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
```

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9633345937/job/26567662854)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9633345937/job/26567662739)
This looks very good, thanks!
This looks very good, thanks!

As far as I know it's recommended to use `exact` to close a goal:

```suggestion
    · exact fun i hi ↦ inv_nonneg.mpr (Real.rpow_nonneg (le_of_lt (hz i hi)) _)
```

Just a simple formatting change: 

```suggestion
    have : ∏ i in s, (1 / z) i ^ w i ≤ ∑ i in s, w i * (1 / z) i :=
      geom_mean_le_arith_mean_weighted s w (1/z) (fun i hi ↦ le_of_lt (hw i hi)) hw'
      (fun i hi ↦ one_div_nonneg.2 (le_of_lt (hz i hi)))
```

Just removed the parenthesis and turned it into a single line:

```suggestion
    · rw [Real.inv_rpow]; apply fun i hi ↦ le_of_lt (hz i hi); assumption
```

This should be implicit because `w` and `z` can be inferred from `hw` and `hz`. 

```suggestion
theorem harm_mean_le_geom_mean_weighted {w z : ι → ℝ} (hs : s.Nonempty) (hw : ∀ i ∈ s, 0 < w i)
```
This is for consistency with all the other theorems in the file

The normal form is never `1/(something)`, but `(something)⁻¹`.

```suggestion
    (∑ i in s, w i / z i)⁻¹ ≤ ∏ i in s, z i ^ w i  := by
```

Same as above 

```suggestion
theorem harm_mean_le_geom_mean {ι : Type*} (s : Finset ι) {w : ι → ℝ}
    {z : ι → ℝ} (hs : Finset.Nonempty s) (hw : ∀ i ∈ s, 0 < w i) (hw' : 0 < ∑ i in s, w i) (hz : ∀ i ∈ s, 0 < z i) :
    (∑ i in s, w i)/(∑ i in s, w i / z i) ≤ (∏ i in s, z i ^ w i) ^ (∑ i in s, w i)⁻¹ := by
```
`hs` could even be `s.Nonempty`. Also, missing spaces around `/`.

Since you are in the middle of the proof, you should squeeze the simp to improve the robustness, by doing `simp? at this` and using the suggested output.

Also, before this line, you have three goals, so you should have started right away with a focusing dot (not relevant if you have used `suffices`).

The style with `have := ` with metavariables on the right hand side (creating new goals) is not always the most readable. Often, it's more readable to use `suffices`. Although here the thing you would have to write is quite long, so it's not clear. Do as you prefer! (but keeping readability in mind :-)

```suggestion
    exact mul_inv_cancel hw'.ne'
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis/MeanInequalities): HM-GM inequality
